annotation.TEXT: Aw, but there were coins over the next pipe as well, so I've gotta wait here for the P-switch to expire now.
D'oh!
Pfft... Blew it with the very first panel...
Zwee!
Alright, it's boss time, against the stage 2 mid-boss, Daiyousei! So, she's starting off by throwing these kunais...
Hey there, Maverick Thwomp. How's it going? ...And now, normal speed bonus game! (I'll wait until the next bonus game to go ludicrous speed again.)
Okay, here's our usual pre-boss ominous music room...
Oh, cape flight is allowed here. I guess only the 3-HP area is a no-fly zone.
Okay, apparently I can smack snowflakes with ice blocks, and... what is with that pipe? I assume that's the exit pipe, but I wonder why it's on layer 2?
Hmm... I might be able to go that way, but it would be a bit of a hassle. Okay, I'm not going to bother right now, but I'll check it out in the easy version of the level later.
Goal tape average so far: 586 / 18 = 32.556 stars each.
Yep, figured those blocks were grabbable.
Whoa, I think that might be one of those electrical blocks that I shouldn't touch. Also, we've got Thwimps that behave like standard Thwomps here.
They're quite slow and easy to dodge.
Okay, the snowflake that moves like a diagonal Podoboo still just freezes me like the others. Also, that was lucky placement for that Charlie-horse.
Daiyousei's Fortress (Normal)
Whoa, that was close!

Through the pipe is an underground waterway that's been frozen over. The water temperature's at zero, so if you stay in for too long, I don't care how intense of an old dude you are, you're gonna die. In other words, when the meter runs empty, you're out. Don't take any Yoshis in there, for their sake.
Still got 6, though.
BGM: Yoshi's Island - Room Before Boss
I saw those ceiling spikes.
So, it would appear that Yoshi is required here in order to not get OMNOMNOM-ed.
Oh, man. She must be angry. Her kunais are now red and faster. They can still be destroyed in the same ways, though.
Whoa! I didn't even notice those layer 2 blocks! I'm lucky they didn't crush me!
DOUBLE KILL!
Well, this shouldn't be too hard, assuming I can time my Bob-omb tosses correctly.
Wow, I'm surprised that one didn't hit.
Science count: 3
Cape spins even work on those snowflakes.
Okay, I made sure not to let the Goomba get wasted on a kunai that time.
Yeah, almost the exact same message as in the easy version. Hmm... Can I ulitize that glitch where I can carry a stomped P-switch through a pipe?
Hello, and welcome back to Scarlet Devil Mario! Alright, let's go straight to the voting results here...
I barely squeezed through there. Also, this P-switch is great for swimming with.
Thwomp fusion! ...Or not. But they tried.
Oh, man. Copyrighted boss music. Let me know if I should use the "Remove song" function to try to get rid of this copyright claim here. UPDATE: I've done so.
Sacrifical horse count: 10
Just like in the easy version, there's a dead end with five Yoshi coins and a Cape Feather. I wonder how tricky it'll be to reach them?
I got him, though. But, the level's not over yet. I'm sure there's a greater fairy that I've gotta battle as well...
BGM: Yoshi's Island - Big Boss
Goal tape average so far: 618 / 19 = 32.526 stars each.
Wait, no Yoshis allowed in the Yoshi Village? That's odd.
I'm now back in the first half of the level! This means that, with a cape, it's possible to skip the entire second half of this level and all of its icy-laggy-wateriness!
An extra cape to make up for my earlier screw up is certainly nice.
HARRY UP!
No, the battle's still going. Well, I'm going to speed up the footage again.
I wonder what the purpose of that Charlie-horse is...
Hahah! But I can shell jump! Take that, unfair level design!
Whoa, that was weird. Mario got clogged in the top of the pipe there for a second. I wonder why that happened?
That looks like a tricky Yoshi coin to retrieve.
Alright, there's the goal. Now, someone asked me to try flying over the wall to the left at the end of Yoshi Village in Winter (Easy). I guess I could try that here.
Uh, huh. I see...
I wonder what's even the point of that Thwomp up there?
Can I maybe fly back up and check out what's even further to the left?
Bonus game average: 37 / 6 = 6.167 1-ups each.
Ooh, a Goomba. So, that's how I attack Daiyousei.
Alright, Yoshi Village in Winter (Normal) is where I'm heading next!
Yeah, that vertical line of coins here would've reverted back into an impassable wall if I was too slow after hitting the P-switch.
Meh, 30.
Oh, this is convenient. I can feed him Bullet Bills and snowflakes right here.
Umm... This is different...
Yep! Oh, BTW, I remembered to cut out the lengthy loading periods this time. So, as it said, it removed my power up. However, this midpoint will embiggen me again.
Huh, I can use those SMB3 pipes even if I don't have my feet on solid ground.
Push!
Whoa, her other bullets now aim for me, which makes them slightly more threatening.
Well, whatever. Let's go get that P-switch... or, not...
Pfft... Don't mind me. I'm just making a dumb screw up here.
Here we have an upside-down Thwomp, and are there also Maverick Thwomps? ...Yep.
At least I correctly noted that I shouldn't enter this pipe right away.
What happens if I let the temperature gauge get completely empty? (I'll ludicrously speed up some of the waiting.)
LOL, I was freeze-locked there for a moment, until that duder walked into my Yoshi's feet and went poof!
BGM: Touhou 6 - Stage 2 - Lunate Elf
Ooh, looks like this is a good level to revisit if I ever need some quick capes later.
Oh, what? I have to sacrifice Yoshi now? Bye, Yoshi!
BGM: Chrono Cross - The Brink of Death (Boss Battle)
I definitely want every Yoshi coin.
Oh, there's a Yoshi. Also, a message box.
Okay, now for one last thing, and it's convenient that I was able to backtrack in the level like this.
There we go! The fourth hit ended the battle!
Place your votes now!
Oh, interesting. It made that Thwomp-Thwimp change its behavior to act like a normal Thwimp.
Yep, death! To be continued... Ze!
Okay, that one hit.
Umm... Okay...
Alright, got it.
Seriously, game? Well, this isn't going well.
There's the ON/OFF switch.
I don't have a Yoshi, so I'd better be careful of these Flying Wigglers. Fortunately, cape spins work on them.
Oh, she's firing some vertical white bullets here.
Oh, really? You can destroy them with a spin jump? Then, a normal stomp should be safe, right? ...Yep!
Okay, so what happens if I fly over the wall behind me at the end here? I'll do a Yoshi jump to help me make it.
You can spin jump on the white bullets, but you just bounce off, so I'm going to assume that trying to normal stomp them would just hurt you.
Huh. Enemies can pass through those gray blocks.
Will the third hit finish the job?
This is the Yoshi village. Alas, even this village has been brought into a harsh winter thanks to that ice fairy. You have three HP in this stage. Also, you can't fly with a cape.
That works for me.
Cool. I got all the Yoshi coins.
There's the second hit.
Okay, we can do it this way.
Anyway, looks like I simply just have to get here in an embiggened state in order to reach the Yoshi coins and cape.
Aw, I didn't think that that would be a multi-coin block.
Yep, so I do indeed see the 3 HP up there. And, the game made me caped for this part but took away my flying ability. Alright, let's start feeding this little guy now.
So, you want me to spin jump on this Urchin? Well, thanks to those convenient coins, I can just do this instead!
Oh, right. I can't bounce off of those things.
That would've been funny if I stomped that last Flying Wiggler there.
Nuts, I was really hoping there wouldn't be another hidden block there... How can I get to the P-switch now? I can't fly, because this level disabled that.
Huh, this level is ending with a standard goal. Well, I should be able to trigger a bonus game with any remotely decent goal tape hit.
Umm... Okay, are those Thwimps asleep or something? Maybe they'll wake up when I hit the ON/OFF switch that I'm sure I'll eventually encounter.
Daiyousei: "Little Cirno is a precious friend to me. So I won't let people make her out to be a fool!"
Oh, neat. We've got these SMB3 pipes too.
Ehh... I've heard better quality ports of this song, but this is an older hack.
Alright, that unlocked the normal difficulty of the greater fairy's fortress.
Now, unlike last episode, I really want to make another level's worth of progress today, so I'm going to go and play Daiyousei's Fortress (Easy) now.
Really, game? A stun-quake Thwomp? I generally dislike those, because they seem cheap, and usually don't look any different from normal Thwomps.
Also, you can cape-thwack them.
Those cannot be cape-thwacked. Okay, now we're back to the kunais. Umm... Are you going to give me a way to attack you?
Ah, I see. It's a race where I have to climb up faster than that Charlie-horse so that he doesn't trap me.
In fact, it seems like cape spins work on just about every enemy here.
And so, that unlocked the easy version of our favorite ice fairy's castle. So, which level should I play next? Daiyousei's Fortress (Normal), or 9-Ball Cirno's Castle (Easy)?

Ice Fairy: "This is the fortress of my bestest friend Dai. Also, there's a lot of those Thwompy guys here. Also, it's probably not a good idea to touch those electrified blocks. Also, what's a fortress?"
HARRY UP!
Whoa, that guy's now a Maverick. For a second there, I thought he had gone to sleep.
Oh, I bet this is where the midpoint entrance to this level is. So, we've already seen this same message before.
ARGH! I HATE THAT SO MUCH! Why can't they just use the skull-and-crossbones blocks for torpedo launchers instead of pipes that I'll want to try entering?

Through the pipe is an underground waterway that's been frozen over. The water temperature's at zero, so if you stay in for too long, I don't care how intense of an old dude you are, you're gonna die. When you go through the pipe, you'll become small and lose your reserve item.
D'oh! I was on a roll, too...
Okay, so there was a P-switch, which I guess I'll need to use here...
Huh, that saw must be kept on the platform by a solid-for-enemies-only block.
Whoa, I saw that slightly off-color block there! So, we've got layer 2 shenanigans, eh?
Now, before I end the episode, let's revisit the end of Yoshi Village in Winter (Easy)...
Those Thwimps are now awake, and just jumping in place. I think I'll call them Ninji-Thwimps.
Alright, Yoshi's all grown up now!
What the french toast was that?! I totally should've hit her there, and then a kunai screwed me over on the next attempt! Okay, I'm speeding up the footage here.
9-Ball Cirno's Castle (Easy)
Oh, boy. It's the Thwomp Boss. Well, it's not like we haven't already seen this guy 57 thousand times in other hacks...
No Yoshis because they're too busy trying to figure out why they can't enter Yoshi Village in Winter (Normal).
